meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by dialogue.
meanings.sent1: The dialogical conversation between the two friends was filled with laughter.
meanings.sent2: The students engaged in a dialogical discussion about their favorite books.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog had a dialogical argument over who gets to sit on the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The dialogical relationship between the author and the reader creates a unique bond.
meanings.sent5: The dialogical nature of the play made the audience feel like they were part of the story.

meanings.sent1: The dialogical scene in the movie was the most memorable part.
meanings.sent2: The play had a dialogical structure that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The dialogical exchange between the siblings was both funny and heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: The dialogical approach to conflict resolution proved to be effective in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The dialogical nature of the negotiation helped both parties reach a mutual agreement.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a dialogue or dialogues.
meanings.sent1: The dialogical format of the podcast allowed for open discussions on various topics.
meanings.sent2: The dialogical nature of the meeting encouraged active participation from all members.
meanings.sent3: The dialogical tone of the book made it an enjoyable read for both children and adults.
meanings.sent4: The dialogical style of communication promoted understanding and empathy.
meanings.sent5: The dialogical approach to teaching helped students develop critical thinking skills.
